website_summaries.verdict: These shears are affordable, lightweight, sharp, and durable. They're best for grasses and greenery in areas where you need to cut with precision.
pros: Useful for trimming hedges, borders, and more
cons: Not recommended for twigs and heavier growth that is pencil-thick or greater

customer_reviews.title: Long, sharp, light weight with excellent shock absorption
customer_reviews.text: First, I am not paid to write this review. I use the reviews also, just giving you my thoughts. Now, I love these shears. I would buy again. They have a long "fixed" extension. The extendable ones (I despise) never stagnate and always need constant adjustment. I've had this pair a year now, they are sharp and get the job done. They seem durable. For, me I have no negative comment. Yes, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HustonX

customer_reviews.title: cut well
customer_reviews.text: So far they cut well; I bought them as a replacement for a hedge shear that broke apart (it had a kind of double lever mechanics, and the bolt that held it together broke off, and could not be replaced since it had to be flush to let the other lever pass), and so far I believe having sharp shears makes more difference than the double-lever mechanics in the predecessor. I use it to cut hedges, and especially to cut the branches in smaller pieces. The previous hedge shear lasted seven years, so perhaps that is the right time to buy a new one anyway.
customer_reviews.author: xxx

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight and sharp
customer_reviews.text: These shears are really sharp and light; the pair I had previously came over on the ark and were heavy, etc. They finally came apart. I decided since I have to stay home due to Covid this was a good time to purchase new shears. This was a very useful and worthwhile purchase. They have really made trimming/shearing bushes a lot easier and almost enjoyable if that's possible. Would highly recommend. Thanks for such a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: O C Moody

customer_reviews.title: Trims well, pretty big
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I find that extending your arms when you snap it in one motion helps cut larger branches. Reasonably light, chops with no issues. Don’t expect to cut branches a few inches thick of course! It helps with the smaller tree branches of leaves I have that get too low, I just snip em when I see em. The length really helps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: snipper-dodo
customer_reviews.text: adequate for trimming, but superb for removing small branches -- up to 1/2 inch -- because of the ample length of the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Hon Lee

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just started working on my yard and these clippers are a pleasure! Lots of Juniper plants that needed a haircut, this tool got it done.
customer_reviews.author: E. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sharp but soft blades
customer_reviews.text: This cutter is sharp and light. However, you cannot cut any woody twig without denting the blade. If you know that you can only cut green stems, you will love it. Otherwise, you will think it is a piece of junk. It would be a perfect took if they used hardened steel blades.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, blades are sharp and made with good quailty steel.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them much but very sturdy feeling. Company sends pruning tips which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: groggo

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Light and Very Sharp
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a weak wrist, and uses this to cut grass along the edge of gardens, along with it's normal uses. She is very pleased. It cuts easily and cleanly, and does not stress her wrist as normal shears would do.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kightweight and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great shears. Love the long arms and the blades are really sharp. Tried it on my overgrown box hedge and Wow! So easy to cut it. It doesn't tear like electric shears and gives a nice, neat cut. I cant rate sturdiness yet because I haven't used it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pere

customer_reviews.title: Good tools
customer_reviews.text: I got to use these snips a couple of days back, I was highly impressed with this tool. It is very sturdy and I will be using them for long time. I also bought a set of pruning snip from your company, and i am equally impressed with them.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Son

customer_reviews.title: Great hedge shears
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient, lightweight with sharp blades! I have used many shears before and these are my new favorite.
customer_reviews.author: CofSFO

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Trimmed four Spirea bushes and five Boxwoods that I would usually use an electric trimmer on. This tool made trimming more precise with totally clean cuts.
customer_reviews.author: silental

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on Thursday and received it on Friday. It is very light, sharp, easy to use and it is made in Taiwan. I am very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ruru

customer_reviews.title: Better then Expected
customer_reviews.text: These shears are awesome. Seem to be well made and are extremely sharp, cutting shrubs & small limbs with no problem. Wish my older shears had broke sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Super Sharp & East to Use.
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best garden shears I’ve ever owned. They’re super sharp. Way to use. I feel like I’m a Samurai gardening warrior using these great shears. Highly. Highly. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: JWA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect choice!
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, perfect size for trimming and pruning! Sturdy, great quality! Everything I wanted/needed them to be!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Schrader

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 min of use
customer_reviews.text: I had two small woody shrubs and was only about 1/2 through the first one and one of the handles snapped. After reading the instructions further I found that you are not supposed to cut woody type shrubs with these. Very sad I wasted $35 on these.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T

customer_reviews.title: love the lightness and precision of this tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is everything all the 5 star reviews said it was. Beautiful and efficient tool!
customer_reviews.author: wants2know

customer_reviews.title: You know what you need
customer_reviews.text: And I knew what I needed. And this was it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyu

customer_reviews.title: satisfied
customer_reviews.text: good product I've used it a couple of times and I'm really pleased with the performance
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Correa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent investment
customer_reviews.text: I love these sharp and lightweight shears for shrub trimming. Easy to use, lightweight, and very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: viola

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight just maybe the blades could be a lil longer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light and smooth to use
customer_reviews.text: Liked it in every aspect - light, sharp, easy to use, ... The best I've used so far...
customer_reviews.author: BeHappy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Light weight. Cut through my yellow bell hedge with so much ease. Love these shears
customer_reviews.author: Deborah A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight clippers make it easy to use. My handyman approves!
customer_reviews.text: I am short and older so trimming shrubs is difficult. I like these because they are very light and have a long reach so I can get to shrubs that are taller than me. My shrub beds needed a lot of work so my handyman used these clippers the first time and he really liked them. He said they are light in weight and the blade is the exact right length. The entire length is 30 inches and I got the smooth blade.
customer_reviews.author: carolinagirl

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I had chosen the 30" aluminum version because of the relatively light weight. Used it the next day and I must say, I like it. It has a far reach and I found it easy to use. The price was not too bad either. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid

customer_reviews.title: Worth More!
customer_reviews.text: Well made, very user friendly as in precise, sharp well balanced. Great for my holly trees, especially when shaping to topiary. I feel that these will have a very long life.
customer_reviews.author: carolineTop Contributor: Pets

product_meta.title: TABOR TOOLS B229A Mechanical Hedge Shears with Straight Blade and Comfort Grip Aluminum Handles, 30 Inch Manual Hedge Clippers for Trimming Borders, Topiaries Boxwood, and Decorative Grasses.
